column2: Civil Code 1798.85 prohibits: Publicly posting SSNs, printing on ID cards, requiring for login without password, mailing with SSN visible, sending unencrypted over internet.
Prohibits public entities from issuing a license, permit, or pass that contains the holder's SSN.

column1: Washington My Health My Data Act
column2: Protects non-HIPAA health data, restricts geofencing near healthcare facilities, includes private right of action.
Prohibits genetic discrimination in employment/insurance; includes private right of action.
Prohibits geofencing around healthcare facilities for advertising/profiling. Radius: 1,850 feet.
Regulates disclosure of e-book viewing data. Requires court order showing 'compelling interest'.
Requires high privacy defaults and DPIAs for services likely accessed by children.

column1: New York SAFE For Kids Act
column2: Prohibits 'addictive feeds' for minors without parental consent. Nighttime notification ban (12 AM - 6 AM).
Requires warrants for law enforcement to access electronic communications (emails, location data).
Strict written consent required before collecting biometrics.
Liability limits: One violation per person (not per scan). 'Written release' includes electronic signatures.
Regulate biometric capture/sale but enforced ONLY by the State AG (no private right of action).
Regulates 'high-risk' AI systems making consequential decisions (hiring, lending).
Requires bias audits for AI tools used in employment.
Stricter than GLBA. Requires Opt-In for sharing with unaffiliated third parties.
Mandates rigorous security (CISO, Encryption, MFA) for financial institutions in NY.
Centralized deletion mechanism. 2028 Audit requirement (every 3 years). Penalty: $200/day per request.
First state law regulating data brokers. Requires annual registration, security program, and free credit freezes.
